note.p: Birth: King David's Lane, Shadwell, London, England (12 March 1838)
Burial: Christ Church graveyard, Harrow, Middlesex
Research Field: Synthetic organic chemistry, physical organic chemistry
Education: City of London School (1851-1853); Royal College of Chemistry (from 1853)

Career: Set up a laboratory in his own home to study organic chemistry (1854); discovered mauve (1856) and continued to discover and market synthetic dyes; set up a manufactory in Greenford Green to make mauve
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1907-1908 vol 80 pp xxxviii-lix signed by R M
Notes: DNB does not specify location of Shadwell; birthplace 'London', 'The Times' 12 March 2001
